<description type="note">Preliminaries and introductory material omitted<lb/>The following plays have been taken from this source:</description>

Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.

Abeel I wolde ffayn knowe how I xuld do to serue my lord god to his plesyng Ã¾er fore Caym brother lete us now go vn-to oure ffadyr with-owte lettyng Suenge hym in vertu and in norture to com to Ã¾e hy?e joy celestyall remembryng to be clene and pure for in mys-rewle we myth lythly fall A-?ens hevyn kynge lete us now don oure dyligens to come to oure faderys presens Good brother passe we hens to knowe ffor oure levynge. Caym As to my fadyr lete us now tee to knowe what xal be his talkyng and Ã¾at I holde it but vanyte to go to hym ffor Any spekyng to lere of his lawe Ffor if I haue good a-now plente I kan be mery so moty the thow my fadyr I nevyr se I ?yf not Ã¾er of An hawe. Abel Ryth sovereyn fadyr semely sad and sure euer we thank ?ow in hert body and thowth And alwey shull whyll oure lyf may indure as inwardly in hert it kan be sought bothe my brother and I Ffadyr I ffalle on-to ?our kne to knowe how we xul rewlyd be ffor godys Ã¾at fallyth bothe hym and me I wolde ffayn wete trewly. Adam Sonys ?e arn to spekyn naturaly The ffyrstffrute of kendely engendrure Be-fforn whom saff ?our modyr and I were nevyr non of mannys nature And ?it were we al of a nother portature As ?e haue me oftyn herd seyd sothly Wherfore sonys yf ?e wyl lyff sad and sure Ffyrst I ?ow counseyll most syngulerly God ffor to loue and drede And suche good as god hath ?ow sent the fyrst frute offyr to hym in sacryfice brent hym evyr be-sechyng with meke entent In all ?our werkys to save and spede. Abeell Gramercy ffadyr ffor ?our good doctrine Ffor as ?e vs techyn so xal we do And as ffor me Ã¾orwe goddys grace dyvyne I wyl fforth with applye me Ã¾erto. Cayme And Ã¾ow me be loth I wyl now also On to ?our counsell ffadyr me inclyne and ?itt I say now to ?ow both too I had levyr gon hom well ffor to dyne. Adam Now god graunt good sacryfice to ?ow both too he vowche-saff to acceptyn ?ow and all myne and ?eve ?ow now grace to plesyn hym soo Ã¾at ?e may come to Ã¾at blysse Ã¾at hym self is inne With gostly grace Ã¾at all ?our here levyng may be to his plesyng and at ?our hens partyng to com to good place. Abell dicit Al-myhtty god and god ful of myth be whom all Ã¾ing is made of nowth to Ã¾e myn hert is redy dyht for upon Ã¾e is all my thought O souereyn lord reygnyng in eternyte with all Ã¾e mekenesse Ã¾at I kan or may This lombe xal I offre it up to the accept it blyssyd lord I Ã¾e pray my ?yft is but sympyl Ã¾is is no nay but my wyl is good and evyr xal be Ã¾e to servyn and worchepyn both nyht and day and Ã¾er to Ã¾i grace grawnt Ã¾ou me throwh Ã¾i gret mercy which in a lombys lyknes Ã¾ou xalt for mannys wyckydnes Onys ben offeryd in peynfulnes and deyn ful dolfoly. Ffor trewly lord Ã¾ou art most worthy Ã¾e best to haue in eche degre both beste and werst ful certeynly all is had Ã¾urowe grace of Ã¾e The best schep full hertyly amonges my flok Ã¾at I kan se I tythe it to god of gret mercy And bettyr wold if bettyr myht be Evyn here is myn offryng I tythe to Ã¾e with ryht good wylle of Ã¾e best Ã¾ou sentyst me tylle now gracyous god on hevyn hille Accept now my tythyng. Caym Amonges all folys Ã¾at gon on grownd I holde Ã¾at Ã¾ou be on of Ã¾e most to tythe Ã¾e best Ã¾at is not sownd and kepe Ã¾e werst Ã¾at is nere lost But I more wysly xal werke Ã¾is stownde to tythe Ã¾e werst and make no bost Off all my cornys Ã¾at may be fownde In all my ffeldys both croft and cost I xal lokyn on every syde here I tythe Ã¾is vnthende sheff lete god take it or ellys lef Ã¾ow it be to me gret repreff I ?eve no ffors Ã¾is tyde. Abell Now Caym brother Ã¾ou dost ful ill Ffor god Ã¾e sent both best and werst Ã¾erfore Ã¾ou shewe to hym good wyll and tythe to god evyr of Ã¾e best. Caym In feyth Ã¾ou shewyst now a febyll skyll it wolde me hyndyr and do me greff what were god Ã¾e bettyr Ã¾ou sey me tyll to ?evyn hym awey my best sheff and kepe my self Ã¾e wers he wyll neyther ete nor drynke Ffor he doth neyther swete nor swynke Ã¾ou shewyst a ffebyl reson me thynke what Ã¾ou fonnyst as a best I gesse. Abell ?it me thynkyth my wyt is good to god euer more sum loue to shewe Off whom we haue oure dayly food and ellys we had but lytyl drewe. Caym ?itt me thynkeht Ã¾i wytt is wood Ffor of Ã¾i lore I ffynde but ffewe I wyll neuer Ã¾e more chawnge my mood Ffor no wordys Ã¾at Ã¾ou dost shewe I sey I wyll tythe Ã¾e werst. Abell Now god Ã¾at syt in hefne aboue On whom is sett all myn hool loue Ã¾is wyckyd wyll from Ã¾e he showe As it plesyth hym best. Hic ardent decimum Abel et Caym quo facto dicit Caym herke abel brother what a-ray is Ã¾is thy tythyng brennyth as ffyre fful bryght it is to me gret wondyr i-wys I trow Ã¾is is now a straunge syght. Abell Goddys wyll fforsothe it is Ã¾at my tythyng with fyre is lyth Ffor of Ã¾e best were my tythis and of Ã¾e werst Ã¾ou dedyst hym dyght bad thyng Ã¾ou hym bede of Ã¾e best was my tythyng and of Ã¾e werst was Ã¾in offryng Ã¾erfor god almyghty hevyn kyng Alowyht ryht nowth Ã¾i dede. Caym What Ã¾ou stynkyng losel and is it so doth god Ã¾e love and hatyht me Ã¾ou xalt be ded I xal Ã¾e slo Ã¾i lord Ã¾i god Ã¾ou xalt nevyr se Tythyng more xalt Ã¾ou nevyr do With Ã¾is chavyl bon I xal sle Ã¾e Ã¾i deth is dyht Ã¾i days be go out of myn handys xalt Ã¾ou not fle With Ã¾is strok I Ã¾e kylle Now Ã¾is boy is slayn and dede Of hym I xal nevyr more han drede He xal here after nevyr ete brede With Ã¾is gresse I xal hym hylle. Deus Caym come fforth and answere me a-soyle my qwestyon anon ryght thy brother Abel wher is now he ha don and answere me as tyght. Caym My brothers kepere ho made me Syn whan was I his kepyng knyght I kan not telle wher Ã¾at he be to kepe hym was I nevyr dyght I know not wher he is. Deus A cursyd Caym Ã¾ou art vntrewe and for Ã¾i dede Ã¾ou xalt sore rewe Ã¾i brothers blood Ã¾at Ã¾ou slewe Askyht vengeauns of Ã¾i mys. Thu xalt be cursyd on Ã¾e grounde Vn-prophitable where so Ã¾ou wende both veyn and nowthty and no thyng sounde with what Ã¾ing Ã¾ou medele Ã¾ou xalt it shende. Caym Alas in whoo now am I wounde a-cursyd of god as man vn-kende of any man yf I be founde He xal me slo I haue no ffrende Alas and wele Away. Deus Of what man Ã¾at Ã¾ou be sclayn he xal haue vij folde more payn hym were bettyr to be sayn on lyve be nyth ne day. Caym Alas alas whedyr may I go I dare nevyr se man in Ã¾e vesage I am woundyn as a wrecch in wo And cursyd of god ffor my ffalfage Vn-profytabyl and vayn also In felde and town in strete and stage I may nevyr make merthis mo I wot nevyr whedyr to take passage I dare not here abyde Now wyl I go wende my way With sore syeng and wel away Introitus Noe to loke where Ã¾at I best may Ffrom mannys ssyht me hyde.
